page.title: 18Whiteparish Surgery
page.content: {The Medical Centre was opened on the {30th. Jan. 1983 by Joan Witchell, S.R.N.,S.C.M.,N.D.N.cert., who had been our district nurse & midwife for 38 yrs. The building cost nearly Â£130,000. It{serves approximately 5000 {people.}At the time it was built there were 3 partners in the practice & 2 trainee assistants.There are also dispensing, secretarial & records staff and a cleaner. Also attached to the practice are a Health Visitor & a District Nursing Sister. The practice employs its own Nursing Sister for work as a practice nurse. A radius of about 5 miles is covered by the Practice. It is concerned with the treatment of illness in the community & also with the prevention of illness & advice concerning health matters .See also{page 19. "Community Nursing {Services."}Contributor:- Dr.J.D.Baston
